result.execSummary:
The defendant Tucker E Balisteri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay image surcharge of $2,500.00 for five (5) images.  Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victims A.C. and A.K. or their families for residences.
No contact with persons under the age of 18 years without agent approval.
No possession of electronic devices.  No access to pornographic materials.
*09-14-2018 Conditions of prohibition is amended to:
No use or possession of electronic devices without prior Agent approval.
Register and comply with sex offender registry.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) commencing 07/27/2015 SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT received and filed.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Paul E Bucher and Julia Westley.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by:  Joy B.
There is no restitution being requested.  Court sets restitution at ZERO.  There is a stipulation that the mandatory image surcharge will be for FIVE images ($2500.00).
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay image surcharge of $2500.00 for FIVE(5) images.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Register and comply with sex offender registry.
-No contact with victims, A.C and A. K. or thei families or residences.
-No contact with persons under the age of 18 years without agent approval.
-No possession of electronic devices; no access to pornographic materials.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Crime Victim Impact Statements received and filed.
Received from defense, Pathways Counseling Center (CONFIDENTIAL)
Defense Independent Presentence Report received and filed.
PSI emailed to ADA Shomin.  Atty Bucher's office contacted that PSI is available.
Defendant's Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the court will dismiss and read in count 2 for sentencing as well as all 11 counts of disorderly conduct in 15CM733.
AS to count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty. Defendant advised must register as a sex offender and may be subject to Chapter 980 filings.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court will order a PSI and the defense will also submit a private sentencing memorandum.  Case is adjourned to 7-27-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Bucher is requesting an adjournment of the final pretrial to which the state does not object.
Defense believes that matters may be resolved short of trial on June 1.  The state will be filing a motion to consolidate for trial if they do not resolve on 5-29-2015.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Thomas Simon for Paul E Bucher.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Misdemeanor case 15CM733 has now been charged and the inital appearance has been made.
The State is working on resolving cases with the defense.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state advises the court that it will be issuing misdemeanor charges by next week and then will be moving to consolidate all charges.  Counsels are hopeful that matters can be resolved short of trial.  Status date of 3-17-2015 at 8:15 is set so all matters can be joined.
Case set for final pretrial on  5-11-2015 at 9am.  Jury trial set for 6-1-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.
Defense is requesting that the scheduling conference be set on 2-25-2015 at 8:15; ADA Shomin has no objection.
Bucher Law Group, LLC

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state provided discovery to counsel and advised that there may be additional charges issued; state to review allegations next week.  Counsels are requesting another scheduling date when all matters may be set.  Case adjourned to 2-26-2015 at 9am for scheduling.
filed by Atty Paul Bucher.

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Michael Thurston for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Computers or the Internet

Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tucker E Balisteri in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
